content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Coal Mining Operation at (-14, -15)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0)
- Wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5) containing 112 coal

###Iron Mining Operation at (-14, 23)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0) mining iron ore
- Wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5) containing 563 iron ore

###Copper Mining and Smelting Complex at (20, 20)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Input wooden chest at (20.5, 21.5)
- Middle wooden chest at (22.5, 21.5) containing 386 copper ore
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
- Output wooden chest at (24.5, 17.5) containing 53 copper plates
- Transport inserter system:
  - Burner inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving ore from input chest to middle chest
  - Burner inserter at (22.5, 20.5) moving ore from middle chest to furnace
  - Burner inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving plates from furnace to output chest

###Unused Furnace Group at (-10, 20)
Consists of:
- Two stone furnaces at (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0)

ERROR TIPS

###Inserter Placement Issues
- Ensure inserters are properly aligned with their source and destination entities
- Check that inserter's pickup and drop positions match the intended workflow
- Verify there is a valid destination entity before placing inserters to avoid "no sink entity" errors

###Fuel Management
- Keep mining drills fueled to prevent "out of fuel" warnings
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters to maintain continuous operation

###Production Flow Issues
- Ensure complete production chains are set up before starting operations
- Verify all components (mining drill -> chest -> inserter -> furnace) are properly connected
- Make sure furnaces have both fuel and ingredients to operate efficiently
